intro: Lychnis dioica var. alba, commonly known as white campion, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces showy, five-petaled white flowers with a distinctive red center. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, erect stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. White campion thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed sites.
